TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , LOC . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON , LOC . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant suffers from cerebral paralysis and has a disability of the second category .
In DATE she sued a local welfare authority in connection with the latter ’s refusal to pay her DATE compensation in respect of her transport expenses .

On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) granted the applicant ’s claim and ordered the welfare authority to pay her a compensation . The court did not specify the amount of the compensation . This judgment was not appealed against and entered into force on DATE .
On DATE , in reply to the applicant ’s query , the bailiffs informed her that they were unable to enforce the judgment of DATE , since the debtor had insufficient funds .
On DATE the applicant lodged a court complaint against the bailiffs for their failure to enforce the judgment in her favour .

On DATE ORG confirmed the applicant ’s entitlement to the compensation of her transport expenses in the amount of MONEY ( RUR ) per year and ordered the bailiffs to enforce the judgment of DATE within DATE from the date on which the present judgment would become final . It does not appear that any appeal was lodged against the judgment of DATE .

On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request for clarification of the judgment of DATE , ORG ruled that the applicant was eligible for compensation of her transport expenses in the amount of RUR DATE for DATE , and therefore the defendant authority was under obligation to pay her a total sum of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL . This decision was upheld on appeal by ORG on DATE .
On DATE the judgment of DATE , as interpreted by decision of DATE , was paid in full .

On an unspecified date the applicant instituted proceedings against the welfare authority , seeking ORG as compensation for inflation losses sustained by her between DATE , when the judgment in her favour had been given , and DATE , when it had been enforced .

By decision of DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s claims in full and awarded her the requested amount as well as RUR CARDINAL in respect of court expenses . The decision was not appealed against and became final DATE .
On DATE the sum of RUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL was transferred to the applicant ’s bank account .

Section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE provides that a bailiff ’s order on the institution of enforcement proceedings must fix a time - limit for the defendant ’s voluntary compliance with a writ of execution . The time - limit may not exceed DATE . The bailiff must also warn the defendant that coercive action will follow , should the defendant fail to comply with the time - limit .
Under LAW of the LAW , the enforcement proceedings should be completed within DATE of the receipt of the writ of enforcement by the bailiff .
